Detailed Description

template<class T> template class TypeInfoAbstractT

Stores run-time type information (template class for abstract classes).

See the class TypeInfo for a detailed description. The TypeInfoAbstractT class is the same as the TypeInfoT class, except that the createObject() function does not create an object, it just returns 0. Hence, use TypeInfoAbstractT for abstract classes.

Example Program: See the example of the class TypeInfo

const char * parentClassName = 0 ) [inline]
 

Constructs a TypeInfo object.

Parameters:
className   The class name.
parentClassName   The name of the parent class (use 0 for a base class).

TypeInfoAbstractT ( const char * className,
int num,
const char * parentClassName ) [inline]
 

Constructs a TypeInfo object of a class that is template <int num>.

Parameters:
className   The class name.
num   The template parameter.
parentClassName   The name of the parent class.

TypeInfoAbstractT ( const char * className,
int num,
const char * parentClassName,
int parentNum ) [inline]
 

Constructs a TypeInfo object of a class that is template <int num> and has a parent that is also template <int num>.

Parameters:
className   The class name.
num   The template parameter.
parentClassName   The name of the parent class.
parentNum   The template parameter of the parent.
